questions.questionText: How important is it to you that your partner shares your religious beliefs and practices?
options: Extremely important - we must share the same beliefs and level of practice
Very important - same beliefs, but different practice levels are okay
Somewhat important - mutual respect is more important than identical beliefs
Not very important - as long as we respect each other's views
questions.followUpPrompt: What aspects of religious practice would you want to share with your partner?

questions.questionText: What role do you envision your families playing in your married life?
options: Very involved - family gatherings weekly, active in decision-making
Moderately involved - regular visits but maintain independence
Occasionally involved - major holidays and events only
Minimal involvement - we prioritize our own family unit
questions.followUpPrompt: How would you handle disagreements between your partner and your family?

questions.questionText: Which personality trait do you value most in a long-term partner?
options: Emotional intelligence and empathy
Humor and ability to laugh together
Honesty and direct communication
Patience and calmness under pressure
questions.followUpPrompt: Tell me about a time when this trait was important in a relationship.

questions.questionText: What does your ideal lifestyle look like 5 years from now?
questions.followUpPrompt: Describe a typical weekend in your ideal future life.

questions.questionText: How do you think married couples should handle their finances?
options: Completely combined - one joint account for everything
Mostly combined - joint account for shared expenses, separate for personal
Mostly separate - split shared expenses, keep income separate
Flexible approach - whatever works best for both partners
questions.followUpPrompt: How would you approach the conversation if your partner earned significantly more or less than you?

questions.questionText: What's your view on traditional gender roles in marriage?
options: I prefer traditional roles with clear responsibilities
I like some traditional aspects but with flexibility
I prefer equal partnership with shared responsibilities
Roles should be based on individual strengths, not gender
questions.followUpPrompt: How would you and your partner decide who does what in your household?

questions.questionText: When do you envision having children, and how many would you ideally want?
options: Soon after marriage, 3+ children
Within 2-3 years, 2-3 children
After 5+ years or career stability, 1-2 children
Unsure about children or prefer not to have them
questions.followUpPrompt: What's your parenting philosophy? How would you want to raise children?

questions.questionText: When you and your partner disagree, what's your typical approach?
options: Address it immediately - talk through it right away
Take time to cool down first, then discuss calmly
Try to understand their perspective before sharing mine
Seek compromise - focus on finding middle ground
questions.followUpPrompt: Describe a conflict you've resolved successfully. What made it work?

metadata.description: Initial question bank for Zawaj MVP - one question per relationship topic
